original_theorem:
Let $P_1,$ $P_2, $\dots$,$ $P_n,$ \dots\ be
propositions$,$ one
for each positive integer$,$ such that
\begin{alist}
\item % (a)
 $P_1$ is true$;$
\item % (b)
 for each positive integer $n,$  $P_n$  implies $P_{n+1}.$
\end{alist}
Then $P_n$ is true for each positive integer $n.$
theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem principle_of_mathematical_induction (P : PNat → Prop) (h1 : P 1) (h2 : ∀ n : PNat, P n → P (n + 1)) : ∀ n : PNat, P n := by
```

attempt_history.verified_code:
import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem principle_of_mathematical_induction (P : PNat → Prop) (h1 : P 1) (h2 : ∀ n : PNat, P n → P (n + 1)) : ∀ n : PNat, P n := by
  set M := { n : PNat // P n }
  suffices univ : Set.univ = M by
    intro n
    rw [univ]
    trivial
  apply PNat.induction
  · exact h1
  · intro n hn
    exact h2 n hn
  sorry
